channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SEC-2696] Can not inject @AuthenticationPrincipal into @ExceptionHandler method.
item.description:
I've got this use case that I'm trying to access the user information within the exception handler method, unfortunetly such injection does not seams to work.

@ExceptionHandler
 
    public ResponseEntity handleEntityNotFoundException(EntityNotFoundException ex, @AuthenticationPrincipal User user) {
 
        
        // some  error handling
 
        return new ResponseEntity(HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND);
 
    }

Ends with error:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: No suitable resolver for argument [1] [type=org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.User]
 
HandlerMethod details: 
Controller [org.spring.sandbox.rest.advice.RestAdvice]
 
Method [public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity org.spring.sandbox.rest.advice.RestAdvice.handleEntityNotFoundException(org.spring.sandbox.exception.EntityNotFoundException,org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.User)]

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I can prepare a sample project that ilustrates this problem. Additionaly injecting java.security.Principal works fine within the error hanlding methods.
I've made a very basic project to demonstrate this issue: https://github.com/jmnarloch/spring-framework-issues/tree/SEC-2696/SEC-2696
Apparently this issue is due the default behaviour of ExceptionHandlerExceptionResolver: https://jira.spring.io/browse/SPR-12058
Thanks for the detailed writeup! I'm resolving this as as a duplicate of SPR-12058
This issue has been migrated to https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/issues/2916
